titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Anne Nelson-Black papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by William E. Brown, Jr., and staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:44

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of material from El Salvador, including guerrilla propaganda, internal guerrilla memoranda, and U.S. and Salvadoran government documents; material from Puerto Rico relating to the Cerro Maravilla case and the Culebra island controversy; and documents on the 1981-1982 national elections of Honduras, Costa Rica, Guatemala, El Salvador, Mexico, and the Dominican Republic.

langmaterial.language: The papers are in English and Spanish.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Anne Nelson-Black, 1986 and 1991. Transferred from the Latin American Collection Curator, 2016.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Anne Nelson-Black Papers (MS 1444). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Anne Nelson was born in Fort Sill, Oklahoma, and grew up in Lincoln, Nebraska. She graduated from Yale University in 1976. As a journalist, Black covered wars in El Salvador and Guatemala, contributing articles and photographs to numerous publications. Nelson is married to author George Black.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of material from El Salvador, including guerrilla propaganda, internal guerrilla memoranda, and U.S. and Salvadoran government documents; material from Puerto Rico relating to the Cerro Maravilla case and the Culebra island controversy; and documents on the 1981-1982 national elections of Honduras, Costa Rica, Guatemala, El Salvador, Mexico, and the Dominican Republic.
